description: From Ancient Greek πεντάς (pentás), from πέντε (pénte, “five”) + -άς (-ás, “-ad”), equivalent to pent- +‎ -ad.

definitionGroups.group: Synonym of quintet: A group of five things, particularly

entries.meaning: Synonym of quinquennium: a five-year period, especially in reference to the first and second halves of calendrical decades.
(climatology) A five-day period, especially a temperature average taken every five days.
An five-day division of the Chinese calendar, forming part of a solar term (Chinese: 候).
(chemistry) A pentavalent element or group: an atom or molecule with a valence of five, comparable with five atoms of hydrogen.
examples: Nitrogen is a pentad in the ammonium compounds.
